section: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of reasonable hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will use best efforts to schedule and perform such maintenance between the hours of 8pm and 8am Eastern Standard Time on weekdays, or during weekends.
explanation: The phrase 'reasonable hardware and software maintenance' lacks a clear definition, creating ambiguity. There's no limit defined for the maintenance, which means that i-on can do maintenance at any time of their choosing, which directly contradicts the original statement.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 5th day of each month. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: The statement implies immediate interruption or discontinuation of services upon failure to pay by the 5th of the month. However, the contract also stipulates a 30-day written notice for termination. This creates a contradiction: can i-on discontinue service immediately after the 5th, or do they need to provide a 30-day notice?

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice.
explanation: There is a contradiction between the renewal and termination clauses. The agreement automatically renews for one-month periods unless a 15-day notice is given. However, a party can terminate the agreement at any time with a 30-day notice. If a party gives a 20-day notice, will the company continue for another 10 days or the full 30 days?
